definitions.definition: A broad, shallow injury left by scraping (rather than a cut or a scratch).
definitions.example: He fell on the sidewalk and got a scrape on his knee.

definitions.definition: A fight, especially a fistfight without weapons.
definitions.example: He got in a scrape with the school bully.
I'm in a bit of a scrape — I've no money to buy my wife a birthday present.

definitions.definition: A D and C or abortion; or, a miscarriage.
A shallow depression used by ground birds as a nest; a nest scrape.
A shallow pit dug as a hideout.
To draw (an object, especially a sharp or angular one), along (something) while exerting pressure.
definitions.example: Her fingernails scraped across the blackboard.

definitions.definition: To remove (something) by drawing an object along in this manner.
definitions.example: Scrape the chewing gum off with a knife.

definitions.definition: To injure or damage by rubbing across a surface.
definitions.example: She tripped on a rock and scraped her knee.
I scraped a pass in the exam.

definitions.definition: To collect or gather, especially without regard to the quality of what is chosen.
definitions.example: Just use whatever you can scrape together.

definitions.definition: To extract data by automated means from a format not intended to be machine-readable, such as a screenshot or a formatted web page.
To occupy oneself with getting laboriously.
definitions.example: He scraped and saved until he became rich.

definitions.definition: To play awkwardly and inharmoniously on a violin or similar instrument.
To draw back the right foot along the ground or floor when making a bow.
To express disapprobation of (a play, etc.) or to silence (a speaker) by drawing the feet back and forth upon the floor; usually with down.
